subject: Physics
title: Basics of Rocket Thrust
description: Understand how rockets generate thrust and how Newton's laws apply.

content.text: Rockets move by expelling gas at high speeds in one direction to produce thrust in the opposite direction.

content.heading: Newtonâ€™s Third Law in Rocketry
content.text: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction. When gases are pushed out of the rocket nozzle, the rocket is pushed forward.

content.heading: Thrust Example
content.problem: A rocket expels 2 kg/s of exhaust at 1500 m/s. What is the thrust?
